title: All Of the Elegant Items On My Shopping List From the Cyber Monday Sales
description: All Of the Elegant Items On My Shopping List From the Cyber Monday Sales
excerpt: These are the best elegant fashion shopping finds from the Cyber Monday sales.
text: (Image credit: Getty Images) The holidays are in full swing and so are some of the best sales of the year with the arrival of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. With big markdowns across nearly every retailer, it’s one of the key times of the year to shop. My approach remains consistent year after year when the sales arrive, and I always shop pieces from a running wish list to make sure the buys are pieces I wanted in my closet before the sales ever arrived.The running theme in my current shopping list is elegance as I prioritize pieces that are timeless and classic with enduring style and design that I know I will wear for many years to come. That includes everything from sleek leather riding boots and two-tone tote bags to draped satin tops and duchesse silk sheath dresses. Ahead, shop my edit of the best Cyber Monday fashion shopping finds that have a throughline of elegant style. EMME PARSONS Leandra Patent-Leather Mary Jane Pumps COS Leather-Trimmed Wool Scarf Coat The leather trim takes this to the next level. Tove Raquel Silk Maxi Dress TOTEME The Slim Croc-Effect Leather Knee Boots The faux-crocodile finish is stunning. LIBEROWE Arya Draped Satin Blouse SAVETTE Tondo Large Leather-Trimmed Canvas Tote Savette's bags are so timeless. Madewell Leather Collar Flap-Pocket Field Jacket An elevated take on a field jacket. tory burch Sequin Mesh Dress Reformation Arco Cashmere Sleeveless Turtleneck Sweater The workhorse piece to wear all winter. KHAITE Minnie Belted Cotton-Blend Twill Trench Coat To style with elbow-length leather gloves. VERONICA DE PIANTE Grace Duchesse Silk-Satin Midi Dress Jacquemus La Veste Spalla Virgin Wool and Silk Jacket Jacquemus Tozzi Zebra Print Leather Skirt For something a little fun. Khaite Alessio Leather Loafers Khaite Wes Sleeveless Pleated Maxi Dress MANGO Marbled Wool Pleated Skirt Just add a short sleeve knit and pumps. Cara Cara Tay Animal-Print Cotton Mini Dress To style with pointed flats. Vince Naomi Suede Loafers Yes to that top-stitching. KHAITE Ami Draped Silk-Gazar Top When a top isn't just a top. THE ROW Laz Wrap-Effect Wool-Blend Midi Skirt tory burch Faux Croc Skirt When timeless meets modern. Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear with over a decade of experience in fashion, editorial, and publishing. She oversees luxury content and wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. She also contributes to podcast recordings, social media, and branded content initiatives. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, MyTheresa, and Luisa Via Roma, and rising designers such as Refine and Tove, and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Before Who What Wear, Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on assistant styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
html:
(Image credit: Getty Images)

The holidays are in full swing and so are some of the best sales of the year with the arrival of Black Friday and Cyber Monday. With big markdowns across nearly every retailer, it’s one of the key times of the year to shop. My approach remains consistent year after year when the sales arrive, and I always shop pieces from a running wish list to make sure the buys are pieces I wanted in my closet before the sales ever arrived.

The running theme in my current shopping list is elegance as I prioritize pieces that are timeless and classic with enduring style and design that I know I will wear for many years to come. That includes everything from sleek leather riding boots and two-tone tote bags to draped satin tops and duchesse silk sheath dresses. Ahead, shop my edit of the best Cyber Monday fashion shopping finds that have a throughline of elegant style.

EMME PARSONS

Leandra Patent-Leather Mary Jane Pumps

COS

Leather-Trimmed Wool Scarf Coat

The leather trim takes this to the next level.

Tove

Raquel Silk Maxi Dress

TOTEME

The Slim Croc-Effect Leather Knee Boots

The faux-crocodile finish is stunning.

LIBEROWE

Arya Draped Satin Blouse

SAVETTE

Tondo Large Leather-Trimmed Canvas Tote

Savette's bags are so timeless.

Madewell

Leather Collar Flap-Pocket Field Jacket

An elevated take on a field jacket.

tory burch

Sequin Mesh Dress

Reformation

Arco Cashmere Sleeveless Turtleneck Sweater

The workhorse piece to wear all winter.

KHAITE

Minnie Belted Cotton-Blend Twill Trench Coat

To style with elbow-length leather gloves.

Grace Duchesse Silk-Satin Midi Dress

For something a little fun.

Khaite

Marbled Wool Pleated Skirt

Just add a short sleeve knit and pumps.

Cara Cara

To style with pointed flats.

Vince

Naomi Suede Loafers

Yes to that top-stitching.

KHAITE

Ami Draped Silk-Gazar Top

When a top isn't just a top.

THE ROW

Laz Wrap-Effect Wool-Blend Midi Skirt

tory burch

Faux Croc Skirt

When timeless meets modern.

Kristen Nichols is the Associate Director, Special Projects at Who What Wear with over a decade of experience in fashion, editorial, and publishing. She oversees luxury content and wedding features, and covers fashion within the luxury market, runway reporting, shopping features, trends, and interviews with leading industry experts. She also contributes to podcast recordings, social media, and branded content initiatives. Kristen has worked with brands including Prada, Chanel, MyTheresa, and Luisa Via Roma, and rising designers such as Refine and Tove, and her style has been featured in publications including Vogue.com, Vogue France, WWD, and the CFDA. Before Who What Wear, Kristen began her career at Rodarte, where she worked on assistant styling, photo shoots, and runway shows, and at Allure, where she moved into print and digital editorial. She graduated from the University of Southern California, where she studied art history and business, and currently lives in New York.
